intro: Proboscidea sinaloensis, commonly known as the Sinaloan proboscidea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires a warm, sunny climate. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
